SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.tombarrasso.android.wp7ui.widget
Class WPPivotControl

java.lang.Object
  LinearLayout
      com.tombarrasso.android.wp7ui.widget.WPPivotControl
All Implemented Interfaces:
WPPivotHeader.OnHeaderClickListener
public class WPPivotControl
extends LinearLayout
implements WPPivotHeader.OnHeaderClickListener

3-part implementation of the Windows Phone 7 Pivot layout in Android OS 2.1+. This class borrows quite a bit from WPPanorama in terms of scrolling and uses some of the static utilities. To use this layout simply place layouts as children. Each layout is given the maximum width and height based on the screen and cannot take up a different amount. Then in code call either setTab or setTabs passing the appropriate integer ids and string titles.

Note: Due to an implementation feature this layout ONLY works in XML, not when initialized in code!
Change Log:
v1.01

  • Improved bidirectional header scaling
  • Using API 7 2.1
v1.02
  • Prevent drawing of children that are not of type WPPivotHeader or WPPivotView.
v1.03
  • Initialisation via code.
v1.03
  • Support for Zune-style pivots using new textTransform attribute as well as font manipulation.
  • Faster scrolling & better support for multi-touch.
  • "Vertical scroll locking" (Patent Pending)... nah, but during scrolling if you scroll vertical the child
v1.1
  • Added trackpad/ keypad scrolling.

Since:
06-03-2012

addTab

public WPPivotControl addTab(int id,
                             java.lang.String title,
                             View mTab)
Adds a tab to the current pivot control. Note: this method should only be used when initialising via code, not via XML.

Parameters:
id - The id to reference the tab.
title - The title to display in the header.
mTab - The View of the tab.
Returns:
A reference to this WPPivotControl to allow for method chaining.

build

public int build()
Finishes initialisation and builds the pivot. Note: this method should only be used when initialising via code, not via XML.

Returns:
